subject: Fashion
title: Giorgio Armani's Power Suit
description: A quick, practical guide to Giorgio Armani's Power Suit.

hook.text: In the 1980s, Armani removed the armor from suits. They became softerâ€”and somehow more powerful.

buildup.text: Traditional suits were stiff and padded. Armani softened them: relaxed shoulders, fluid fabric.

discovery.text: He dressed Richard Gere in 'American Gigolo' and overnight, every man in America wanted an Armani.

twist.text: Armani made business casual before the term existed. Silicon Valley's relaxed dress code owes him.

climax.text: He proved that authority doesn't need stiffness. You can look powerful without wearing armor.

punchline.text: The softest suit in the room held the most power.

quiz.question: What did Giorgio Armani change about the men's suit?
options: He replaced fabric suits with leather and denim alternatives
He added more padding and structure for a sharper look
He softened the structure, using relaxed shoulders and fluid fabrics
